Description: A conical jar-seal: of light brown clay, with two impressed inscriptions of Khasekhem. These show the king's name together with the figure of the god Ash. The surface of the clay is in rather poor condition and the base is missing.
Curator's comments: On the god Ash, see P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit II (Wiesbaden, 1964), 780-2, note 673. Seals of this type normally have another impression around the base, giving the name of Khasekhem and the title ḥrỉ wḏʒt Ḥr sbʒ bʒw but the base of this example is missing. This inscription is of the type shown in P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit III (Wiesbaden, 1964), pl. 80, abb. 303. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl.XXIII, 200; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit III (Wiesbaden, 1964), pl.9 78, abb.291; see also vol. I, 160 and II, 853, n.971; 1131.
